importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the article was updated, indicating the current status of the government shutdown as of that point in time.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The specific time the article was updated, reflecting the timing of the latest developments in the shutdown's impact.

keyTakeAways: Federal workers are being laid off by the thousands during the shutdown.
Local businesses, including those in Washington, DC and outside national parks, are struggling to fill seats.
Federally-backed housing loans are halted, preventing people from moving into new homes.
The shutdown has a direct financial impact on individuals due to loss of income and on businesses due to reduced operations.
The article invites readers to share personal experiences of how the shutdown has affected their daily finances.

namedEntities.name: federal government
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The governing body of the United States that is experiencing a shutdown.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The federal government shutdown is the central event driving the article’s narrative and financial consequences.

namedEntities.name: Ramishah Maruf
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the reporter providing the news, indicating the source and credibility of the article.

namedEntities.name: CNN
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The media outlet publishing the article.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: CNN is the source of the news, providing context and audience reach.

namedEntities.name: Washington, DC
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major city in the United States, where local businesses are affected.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is mentioned as a location where local businesses are struggling to fill seats due to the shutdown.

namedEntities.name: national parks
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Geographic areas in the U.S. that are affected by the shutdown.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Businesses outside national parks are also struggling, showing the broad geographic impact.

namedEntities.name: federal workers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Government employees who are affected by the shutdown.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They are being laid off in thousands, directly affecting the economy and public services.

namedEntities.name: local businesses
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Small businesses in various locations, including urban and rural areas.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They are struggling to fill seats, indicating economic instability from reduced foot traffic and income.

namedEntities.name: federally-backed housing loans
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Loans supported by the federal government, such as those from FHA or VA programs.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The halt in these loans prevents people from moving into new homes, affecting personal finances and real estate markets.

namedEntities.name: individuals
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Citizens affected by the shutdown's financial consequences.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They face financial strain due to lack of income or job loss, directly impacting personal wallets.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The federal government shutdown has led to widespread financial consequences, including the layoffs of thousands of federal workers, difficulties for local businesses in both Washington, DC and outside national parks to maintain operations, and a halt in federally-backed housing loans that prevent people from moving into new homes. These disruptions directly affect individuals’ personal finances and businesses’ ability to survive, highlighting the broader economic ripple effects of political gridlock.
title: How has the federal government shutdown affected your wallet? by Ramishah Maruf, CNN
